content:
# I have successfully gathered 8 pieces of wood and crafted the assembling machine. My final inventory now contains:
# - 6 wood
# - 5 stone
# - 3 iron ore
# - 2 iron plates
# - 1 copper plate
# - 1 copper cable
# - 1 iron gear wheel
# - 1 electronic circuit

# The stone furnace is currently operational with enough wood as fuel, but it has not produced any iron plates yet since I did not insert iron ore after fueling it.

# To ensure I can produce more iron plates, I will insert 1 iron ore into the stone furnace for smelting.
insert_item(Prototype.IronOre, target=stone_furnace_entity, quantity=1)  # Insert iron ore for smelting.

# I will now wait for the smelting process to complete.
for _ in range(30):  # Maximum 30 seconds wait.
    current_inventory = inspect_inventory(stone_furnace_entity)
    if current_inventory.get(Prototype.IronPlate, 0) >= 1:  # Wait until we have at least 1 iron plate.
        break
    sleep(1)

# After the smelting is complete, I will extract the iron plate.
if current_inventory.get(Prototype.IronPlate, 0) >= 1:
    extracted_iron_plate = extract_item(Prototype.IronPlate, position=stone_furnace_entity.position, quantity=1)

# Now that I have the iron plate, I can check if I have enough materials to craft additional components or machines.
print(f"Final Inventory after extracting iron plate: {inspect_inventory()}")
print(f"Entities on the map: {get_entities()}")
